title: Haunted houses in Chicago 2015
text:
None on 2015-10-09 21:44:00+00:00 
You wouldn't think there'd be enough insane clowns to go around. Multiplying like cockroaches, as hard to exorcise as demonic spirits, haunted houses have popped up all over the suburbs (for the most part, these places are in the suburbs). Whether you are a haunt enthusiast or have never set foot inside one, the basic (blood-covered) drill is the same: You pay your money, you go inside and get scared. Several haunts have more than one "house" per location and most now offer fast passes for an extra charge to skip the admission line. 
And we say this in our annual guide to Chicago-area haunted houses every year, but we stress: Few to none of these places are suitable for children. Most are pretty darn unsuitable for adults too. 
New to our guide this year, some scary shows in the spirit of Halloween. By Zach Freeman , Morgan Greene , Chris Jones and Doug George . Photos are contributed by the haunts unless specified; above photo from 13th Floor by Andrew A. Nelles for the Tribune. All slides in this TACO
